resources.string: The database operations use the following path on your device. \nThis path is accessible to other Android applications and your computer. \nExpect to find your exported database (or place the database you want to import) there:

The activity data recorded with Vimo versions prior to 0.12 must be converted to a new format. \nYou can do this using the button below. Be aware that you must be connected to the device you want to associate the old activity data with! \nIf you already imported your data and are happy with the result, you may delete the old database.
Use the Android Bluetooth Pairing dialog to pair the device.

You are about to install the following app:


%1$s Version %2$s by %3$s
%1$s won\'t work unless you enable Google Play services.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device.
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device.
%1$s won\'t run unless you update Google Play services.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are currently updating.
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
This will delete the device and all associated data!
Really delete the old activity database? Activity data that was not imported will be lost.
Error importing old activity data into new database.
No connected device to associate old activity data with.
No old activity database found, nothing to import.
Really overwrite the current database? All your current activity data (if any) will be lost.
Please wait while merging your activity data…
Really delete the entire database? All your activity data and information about your devices will be lost.
Cannot access export path. Please contact the developers.

Make your device discoverable. Currently connected devices will likely not be discovered. On Android 6 or later, you need to activate location (e.g. GPS). If your device does not show up after two minutes, try again after rebooting your mobile device.
Error creating directory for log files: %1$s

YOU ARE TRYING TO INSTALL A FIRMWARE, PROCEED AT YOUR OWN RISK.


 This firmware is for HW Revision: %s
You are about to install firmwares %1$s and %2$s instead of the ones currently on your Mi Band.
You are about to install firmware %s instead of the one currently on your Mi Band.
File cannot be installed, device not ready.
This firmware is not compatible with the device

Since Vimo 0.12.0 we use a new database format. You are able to import old activity data and associate it with the device you are connecting to (%1$s).
 
 If you do not import old activity data now, you can still do it later by tapping the "MERGE OLD ACTIVITY DATA" button in the Database Management Activity"
 
 Please note that you can import data from Mi Band, Pebble Health and Morpheuz but NOT from Pebble Misfit.
Unable to find a handler to install this file.
Please wait while determining the installation status…
An Android Library to display a Change Log
No mac address passed, cannot pair.
This firmware has been tested and is known to be compatible with Vimo.
If you still want to proceed and things continue to work properly afterwards, please tell the Vimo developers to whitelist firmware version: %s
"This firmware is untested and may not be compatible with Vimo.\n\nYou are NOT encouraged to flash it to your Mi Band!"
When your Mi Band vibrates and blinks, tap it a few times in a row.
No valid user data given, using dummy user data for now.
Device time offset in hours (for detecting sleep of shift workers)
Use Heartrate Sensor to improve sleep detection
Alarms to reserve for upcoming events
Unable to install the given firmware: it doesn\'t match your Pebble\'s hardware revision.
Unable to install the given file: %1$s

A pairing dialog is expected to pop up on your Android device. If that does not happen, look in the notification drawer and accept the pairing request. After that accept the pairing request on your Pebble
Show only the notification icon. Hide the caller\'s name and number on incoming calls.
Shift the notification text off-screen. Hide the caller\'s name on incoming calls.
Normal notifications and incoming calls display.
Notifications are automatically removed from the Pebble when dismissed from the Android device
Sync time to device when connecting and when time or timezone changes on Android
If the activity data are not synced with the band, they will not be cleared. Useful if Vimo is used together with other apps.
Disabling this will also stop the Pebble 2/LE to vibrate on outgoing calls
Enable experimental support for Android Apps using PebbleKit
Will keep activity data on the Mi Band even after synchronization. Useful if Vimo is used together with other apps.
Try to get the current location at runtime, use the stored location as fallback
This might help on devices where firmware updates fail
The icon in the status bar and the notification in the lockscreen are shown
The icon in the status bar and the notification in the lockscreen are hidden
Stop unwanted Notifications from being sent based on the Do Not Disturb mode.
Support for applications which send Notifications to the Pebble via PebbleKit.
Will cause logs from watch apps to be logged by Vimo (requires reconnect)
Use experimental Pebble LE support for all Pebbles instead of BT classic, requires paring a "Pebble LE" after non LE had been connected once
This option forces using the latest notification protocol depending on the firmware version. ENABLE ONLY IF YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING!
Enable features that are untested. ENABLE ONLY IF YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING!
If checked the data is stored \"as is\" and is available for later interpretation. NB: the database will be bigger in this case!
If your Pebble 2/Pebble LE does not work as expected, try this setting to limit the MTU (valid range 20–512)
Deactivate this if you have trouble connecting
Send sunrise and sunset times based on the location to the pebble timeline
Enable this if your device has no support for your language\'s font (Currently Cyrillic only)
Do not ack activity data transfer
Use low-latency mode for FW updates
Store raw record in the database
Tap connected device for App Manager
This is a Test Notification from Vimo
Problem with the firmware metadata transfer
Problem with the firmware transfer. DO NOT REBOOT your Mi Band!
About to transfer %1$s of data starting from %2$s
There was an error setting the alarms, please try again!
Warning! By pushing this button you will wipe your database and start from scratch.

Make sure that this skin is enabled in the Weather Notification app to get weather information on your Pebble.

No configuration is needed here.

You can enable the system weather app of your Pebble from the app management.

Supported watchfaces will show the weather automatically.
